text: The Death of General Wolfe is a painting by Anglo-American artist Benjamin West.Mitchell, Charles. "Benjamin West's "Death of General Wolfe" and the Popular History Piece," Journal of the Warburg and Courtauld Institutes, Vol. 7, (1944), pp. 20-33. The painting shows the death of British General James Wolfe during the Battle of Quebec of the Seven Years' War in 1759. The painting is an oil on canvas of the Age of Enlightenment. West made the painting in 1770. It is now in the National Gallery of Canada in Ottawa.National Gallery of Canada ; retrieved 2012-2-1. ==Related pages== * The Death of the Earl of Chatham ==References== Category:1770s paintings Category:American paintings
title: The Death of General Wolfe
